info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN BEDFORD... SOUTHWESTERN BLAIR AND SOUTH CENTRAL CAMBRIA COUNTIES THROUGH 345 PM EDT... At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Portage, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Hollidaysburg, Portage, Roaring Spring, Cresson, Claysburg, Duncansville, Beaverdale-Lloydell, Lilly, Sankertown, Blue Knob State Park, Queen, Ski Gap, East Freedom, Spring Hill, Newry, Cassandra, Blue Knob Ski Resort, Allegheny Portage Railroad National Historic Site and Mt. Aloysius College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania.
